abstract: Has NBC hit a wall in selling the remaining commercial time during the broadcast of Super Bowl XLIII? On Thursday, a couple of additional advertisers stepped forward — GoDaddy and General Electric — suggesting there is little need for a bailout of the peacock network.
snippet: Has NBC hit a wall in selling the remaining commercial time during the broadcast of Super Bowl XLIII? On Thursday, a couple of additional advertisers stepped forward — GoDaddy and General Electric — suggesting there is little need for a bailout of...
lead_paragraph: A few days ago, several articles implied that NBC had hit a wall in selling the remaining commercial time during the broadcast of Super Bowl XLIII on Feb. 1, 2009. Nevertheless, on Thursday, a couple of additional advertisers stepped forward — GoDaddy and General Electric — suggesting there is little need for a bailout of the peacock network.

headline.main: The Super Bowl’s Ad Dance Card Fills Up
